author: Mike Danahey
title: Verizon moving 900 jobs out of Elgin - Elgin Courier-News
text:
Elgin officials expressed disappointment Monday following reports that Verizon Wireless planned to move 900 jobs out of Elgin.
"It's disappointing anytime a business moves from Elgin, but at the same time the city and the Economic Development Group are working to bring more businesses into Elgin, such as Motorola Solutions," Councilwoman Tish Powell said.
Verizon Wireless' plans include adding 200 workers at a new Rolling Meadows call center next year. The company says it will begin hiring the new workers after moving 900 workers from the call center in Elgin to a larger office in Rolling Meadows. The new offices will include the call center, social media team and chat group workers.
The Courier-News initially reported news of the Verizon move in early September, as Elgin unveiled plans for a development agreement with Motorola Solutions. Verizon did not release the number of workers employed in the offices along Big Timber Road in Elgin at that time.

City Manager Sean Stegall told us they said the didn't have space to expand in their Elgin location, and at the same time they were looking to consolidate and bring operations closer together," Councilman Terry Gavin said Monday.
Motorola Solutions is planning to invest $18 million to open a training and manufacturing facility in a vacant, relatively new 300,000 square¿foot space in the Northwest Business Park that would eventually have 200 full¿time workers and as many as 200 seasonal employees.
The economic development agreement fast¿tracks permitting and waives city development, impact and building permit fees for the site and saves the company at least $200,000 to $750,000, depending on what the company ultimately decided to do with the space, according to city officials.
"A good many of the Motorola jobs will be high-tech jobs," Powell said.
Powell and Gavin also noted that JIT, The Packaging Wholesalers, opened over the summer after a $3 million rehabilitation of the property at 1717 Gifford Road formerly occupied by the Ball Aerosol & Specialty Container. The company moved to Elgin from Schaumburg.

(Jane Donahue) While not knowing the number of employees, Gavin noted the size of the location is 500,000 square feet with 51 loading docks.
Last fall, the Elgin City Council offered a resolution of support for the business to take part in the Cook County Class 6b property tax incentive program, which enables industrial properties located in Cook County to more effectively compete with properties located in the collar counties where the property assessment level is generally lower than that of Cook County.
Verizon has headquarters in Schaumburg, not far from Rolling Meadows. The Verizon Wireless Call Center has been in the 127,280-square-foot building at 777 Big Timber Road since 2000.
A spokesperson for Verizon could not be reached for comment Monday afternoon.
